content.text:
I'll warm up by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -type f -name "*.c" -o -name "*.s" -o -name "*.h" -o -name "*.ld" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="read">
<parameter name="path">/home/razz/src/razza/clankeros</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Great! I can see this is ClankerOS - a kernel development project. Here's what I found:

**Repository Structure:**
- **kernel/arch/i386/** - x86 32-bit architecture code (bootloader, GDT, IDT, ISR)
- **kernel/core/** - Core kernel logic (main.c)
- **kernel/include/** - Header files for kernel subsystems
- **docs/** - Documentation including CODING_STYLE.md

**Modified Files:**
- kernel/arch/i386/boot.s
- kernel/arch/i386/linker.ld
- kernel/core/main.c

**New/Untracked Files:**
- GDT (Global Descriptor Table) implementation
- IDT (Interrupt Descriptor Table) implementation
- ISR (Interrupt Service Routine) stubs
- Associated header files
- CODING_STYLE.md documentation

The project is set up for x86 kernel development with assembly bootloader, linker script, and interrupt handling infrastructure. Ready for any search or analysis tasks you'd like me to perform!
